intro: Rabdosia lihsienensis, commonly known as the Hsihsien Rabdosia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
